definitions.definition: To (cause to) gush ; to flow or move in a rush .
examples: The tomato sauce was splurged all over the chips.

definitions.definition: To spend lavishly or extravagantly , especially money.
examples: They decided to splurge on the biggest banana split for dessert.

definitions.definition: To produce an extravagant or ostentatious display.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To (cause to) gush ; to flow or move in a rush .
secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive ) To spend lavishly or extravagantly , especially money. [from 1911]
( intransitive ) To produce an extravagant or ostentatious display.
